title: Drawing, Design for China Cabinet in  Mahogany on Pear-Shaped Feet, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for China Cabinet in  Mahogany on Pear-Shaped Feet
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper right and upper left of design: BRANCH VENEER; at center left of design: BACK COVERED / WITH VELVET; at center right of design: FOUR ADJUSTABLE SHELVES; at lower right corner of sheet: CHINA CABINET / OF MAHOGANY
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Rectangular china cabinet with molded top and glass doors, having 4 adjustable shelves; raised on 4 fluted and tapering columnar legs terminating in pear-shaped feet.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for China Cabinet in  Mahogany on Pear-Shaped Feet, 1900–05. Graphite on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-202
